dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Roy (for himself, Mr. Gosar, Mr. Duncan, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mrs. Boebert, Mr. Lamborn, Mr. Self, Mr. McClintock, Ms. Greene of Georgia, Mr. Biggs, Mr. Miller of Ohio, Mr. Loudermilk, Mr. Jackson of Texas, Mr. Hudson, and Mr. Steube) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit contributions to the United Nations Human Rights Council, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No taxpayer funding for United Nations Human Rights Council Act.

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Secretary of Stateâ€”

paragraph.text: shall withhold from a United States contribution each fiscal year to a regular budget of the United Nations an amount that is equal to the percentage of such contribution that the Secretary determines would be allocated by the United Nations to support the United Nations Human Rights Council; and
may not make any voluntary contributions to the United Nations Human Rights Council.

subsection.text: On the date the Secretary of State withholds funds pursuant to this section, such funds are rescinded and shall not be considered arrears to be repaid to any United Nations Entity.
